intro: Leonohebe tetragona, commonly known as the four-cornered leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leonohebe tetragona is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
